page.title: 16SPECIAL EDUCATION (1)
page.content: LONGFORD, THE HAWTHORNS AND CHAMWELL SCHOOLS ARE BASED ON THE SAME SITE IN LONGFORD LANE. CHAMWELL CATERS FOR CHILDREN WITH PHYSICAL HANDICAPS. IT HAS 80 PUPILS: 28 GIRLS AND 52 BOYS, AGED BETWEEN 2 AND 16.THE CHILDREN COME FROM ALL OVER GLOUCESTERSHIRE. THERE IS AN AVERAGE OF 10 CHILDREN TO EACH CLASS. THEY HAVE EQUIPMENT WHICH DIFFERS FROM THAT OF 'NORMAL' SCHOOLS, SUCH AS WHEELCHAIRS, WALKING AIDS AND STANDING AIDS. THEY HAVE 5 COMPUTERS WHICH ARE USED FOR CHILDREN WHO CANNOT SPEAK. THE CHILDREN WHO CANNOT WRITE LEGIBLY USE SPECIAL SWITCHES.
